messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the JAX-RS (RESTEasy) with Netty as HTTP transport framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To initiate this process, I'll provide you with the path to a file, your task is to determine whether it is possible for this file to contain definitions of REST API endpoints, rather than just project configuration, feature implementation, database operations, unit tests, or functional tests. You need to follow the structured output, including an indication of whether this file contains API entries and the reasoning behind your judgment.

contains_api_entries.description: Whether it is possible for this file to contain definitions of REST API endpoints.
contains_api_entries.title: Contains Api Entries

message.content: {"contains_api_entries":false,"reason":"The file is under src/test/java and named NonDestructiveOpsIT.java (IT = integration test). This indicates it’s an integration test class rather than a JAX‑RS resource. Endpoint/resource definitions are normally in src/main/java; test classes typically contain test logic, setup/teardown, and API calls or mocks. While tests can create temporary test resources, it is highly unlikely this file defines production REST endpoints."}
